website_summaries.verdict: If all you need is a single head and a charging base, this reliable toothbrush is a great option.
pros: A no-frills brush with a single head, charging base, and travel case, making it well suited to single individuals
Though it lacks Bluetooth connectivity, this brush uses a built-in timer to guide your technique
cons: Several customers reported failed batteries after several months of use

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely the PRO 2 2500, even though the images show the old model!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried before ordering as the name and main image showed the Pro 2500 but description suggested it was the Pro 2 2500. But I can confirm this is the PRO 2 2500, meaning it has a Lithium battery instead of the old Nickel based ones, so the battery should last twice as long!
customer_reviews.author: Sim S K

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for the first couple of months then it wouldnt charge at all. Battery died completely. I tried a different charger but that didnt work. I tried this charger with an older oral b toothbrush and that worked, so it was definitely the battery which was faulty.
customer_reviews.author: N. French

customer_reviews.title: Good toothbrush but has failed to work  in just 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toothbrush at the end of Oct17 and started using in mid November. I like the toothbrush very much and it cleaned my daughter's teeth very well. However the reason why I have given it one star is that it no longer holds its charge. I charged it fully one day and by the next morning it was out of charge. I have been trying to contact product support but just placed in a long queue. I'm hoping this is just a one off and I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after using one full charge
customer_reviews.text: Brought this as a gift for my partners birthday. Gave it to him two weeks ago after fully charging it. When it died we fully charged it again only it's not working after a full charge the light just flashes red
customer_reviews.author: jodie

customer_reviews.title: Electric toothbrush with useless battery.
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the other 1 and 2 star reviews. This was an "Amazon Choice" purchase but like other disappointed buyers, I have received an expensive electric tooth brush with a useless battery. Until Oral-B can get their quality control sorted out I will continue to use my old electric tooth brush which is now 5 years old and still managing 7 days use on a single charge. The best bit about this purchase was the ease of returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Centumvir

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped charging properly after 8 months. Try claiming your 2 year guarantee - from Braun, not Amazon by the way - and you get the run around. They offer an email button that does not allow you to email them, and expect you to phone up and argue the toss to get faulty goods replaced. I would never buy a product from Braun again. And Amazon should make it clear that although you are buying from them you have to deal with the manufacturer when things go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The only 6 inch thing you'll want in your mouth.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend because I thought it was the perfect way to tell her that 6 months is way too long to go without brushing your teeth. I have the 2000 series, and I am envious. This toothbrush not only looks great in black, but it's also sooo much quieter than the 2000. I believe this is the series you can stop at if you don't care about features like Bluetooth connections and fancy apps and such that the newer versions boast. I may be wrong, but we did do a quick look and couldn't find many differences with noise or performance. The travel case is awesome. It has slots for the toothbrush and 2 toothbrush heads.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Not Europlug but UK shaver plug BS 4573
customer_reviews.text: This is not the standard Europlug. It is a UK shaver plug which does not fit standard sockets in Denmark, Germany etc. so an adapter is required. Attached image from wikipedia displays difference between plugs. Top one is UK shaver plug BS 4573 - bottom one standard europlug. The toothbrush seems great though.
customer_reviews.author: Toke F

customer_reviews.title: Battery is of poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Liked this toothbrush straight away, used to charge once in every 3 weeks but after using this for couple of months the battery seems to have weakened a lot, now I need to charge after every 3 days, it performs really well with fully charged battery but after 3 days it slows down quite a bit which is frustrating, will look for higher versions or other brand, not a good value for money in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is crap
customer_reviews.text: When I received the new toothbrush I charged it up in accordance with the instructions. It was fully charged in just less than 24 hours. However, the battery died after 6 days (brushing twice a day). BUT ITS SUPPOSED TO RUN FOR 2 WEEKS BETWEEN CHARGING. I recharged the battery again. This time it only lasted 5 days. I contacted the manufacturer who assured me it should last for 2 weeks between charges. Clearly that’s not the case. THE PRODUCT DESCRIPTION IS MISLEADING. You have been warned!
customer_reviews.author: Stephjant

customer_reviews.title: New model feels even better
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Oral-B for years now starting with very early one speed models. This updated version of mid range 2 speed Oral-B is maybe slightly lesser in plastics quality in my opinion but contains better Li-ion battery and it feels stronger, more penetrating when cleaning. Overall best product for money from the range. All the good functions but no gimmicky stuff with extra price tag. Also, this product on offer, costing £30 delivered with bonus travel case was a true bargain. Remember to register your toothbrush online for extended 3 years warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Coronah

customer_reviews.title: my teeth are way cleaner and a lot less problems since I started using electric toothbrushes like this instead of traditional ones
customer_reviews.text: Works well, my teeth are way cleaner and a lot less problems since I started using electric toothbrushes like this instead of traditional ones! Worth buying a Pro 1000 or 2000 or 2500 as these are just better quality and rotate faster than the cheap versions so the job gets done quicker and better (also I suspect these have better Li-ion batteries than the cheap versions, but can't be sure). I took off one star simply because this one seems to rotate slower than my wife's Pro 2000 from 2 years ago that we still use. Although the spec says they should be the same.
customer_reviews.author: S. Judd

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable packaging
customer_reviews.text: Not had a chance to use this product as yet. However it arrived encased in non-recyclable polystyrene. Not good enough Oral B when the damaging effects of this form of product are well-known. Time you realised that passing the buck to the end user for disposal is unacceptable. The last of your products I will purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. F. Creech

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: If you like cleaning your teeth with something that sounds and feels like a pneumatic drill, then this one is for you! I am used to electric and sonic toothbrushes, but the noise this one makes is awful and inside your mouth, your brain rattles. It is in the cupboard as a spare now. I tried to get used to it, but dreading cleaning your teeth is really a stupid situation. Not what I would expect from the brand at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they are excellent. Used last one until it basically fell apart ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had three or four Oral-B/Braun electric toothbrushes, they are excellent. Used last one until it basically fell apart and this one was reduced from £80 to £30 when I was looking for a new one, maybe people don't want a black toothbrush? Comes with two brush heads and a charger. Something that's new is that you don't have to charge for ages before using and apparently you can charge whenever you feel like it instead of waiting for the red light. Fantastic toothbrush, would definitely recommend, especially when on offer!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Turner

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 of these, held charge initially but no longer lasts 2 days of normal use
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, we do not get 2 weeks or anywhere near of use on 1 charge, only lasts 2 days at most of regular usage. Very dissapointed, have tried different sockets, chargers and adapter. But the battery will not hold charge I DO NOT RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Tommy2Times

customer_reviews.title: Bargin!!!
customer_reviews.text: Promptly delivered. Really nice upgrade from my old much cheaper oral b electric that was just not holding much of a charge, although it was over six years old. It has a unique timer function that vibrates every 30 seconds as well as the traditional 2 minute timer and two different speed settings. It also has a money saving feature that prevents the battery being overcharged as well as a flashing red light that tells you if you're pressing too hard. Feels better in the hand as well than the previous cheaper models. A better design at the bottom of the brush that won't go manky and black.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph.

customer_reviews.title: Thee best toothbrush.
customer_reviews.text: After owning three different toothbrushes -Oral-B Pro 2 2500N -Oral-B Genius 9000 -Oral-B Pro 650 I can say that this IS the best toothbrush; The Genius 9000 you'd expect to be the best as it costs £100.00 however, that is not the case. Most of the money for that toothbrush is because it has an app that tells you what you are and are not doing right. Which I found that it never worked correctly so bought this as I wanted a toothbrush that had a pressure sensor on it still. I'd recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Carr

customer_reviews.title: Extended warranty system & Customer service is waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I bought Oral-B Pro 2 2500 CrossAction Electric Toothbrush Rechargeable just over two years ago, registered for their free extended 1 year warranty online at the time. It seem the battery is now dead charging won't last more than a second. I contacted customer service as I couldn't find the copy of extended Oral-B warranty email with Amazon invoice. Their response: 'Unfortunately, this isn’t something that is saved on our side and when registered online it recommends to keep a copy of the confirmation. Unfortunately, without this, we’re unable to book the toothbrush into our service partner.' What an online system and Customer service very disappointed, I did't expect from such a big company like P&G?
customer_reviews.author: Arun Arunasalam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toothbrush cleans very well
customer_reviews.text: We use this twice a day between 2 people. Battery lasts over a week, the head has 2 rpm levels, it 'vibrates' on 30sec intervals and at the 2min interval. Theres a red light that flashes if you have been applying too much pressure. I feel like this does a much better job than a manual toothbrush. The travel case is very handy. Accommodates the brush and x2 heads with room for toothpaste
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Time for the Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I finally upgraded from my old Oral-B 600 toothbrush and the difference is night and day! Massively improved battery life, an improved motor speed (quicker brush rpm), and a timer mode which makes it easy to keep brushing your mouth in a methodical manner! The case is useful, a bit bulky, but perfectly useable for going away and keeping your toothbrush safe for the journey! Definetly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Steff

customer_reviews.title: Great basic toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an all-singing, all-dancing Oral-B toothbrush with bluetooth and 5 brushing modes (only used one of them). This one has two modes and gives a signal every 30 seconds of brushing. In comparison, I sometimes lose track of how many 30-second sessions I have done, whereas the previous one showed the accumulated time on a separate display. The big advantage of this new one is the long charge life from the Li-Ion battery, so we can take it away for several days without needing the charger (two 2-minute brushes a day each for myself and my wife). It is also only half the price of the bluetooth-toothbrush. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hewer

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over 600 Pro
customer_reviews.text: I've had a 600 Pro for several years. Although still functional it's starting to lose power and it's also become difficult to clean the residue from the body and charging base. The 2500 is noticeably more powerful and also comes with a hand carry case. The black body appears to be slightly rubberised so I hope that will help to prevent residue. Mine is plugged into a shaving socket and is permanently on charge so I can't comment on battery life. For £30 it appears to be a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Beats my philips diamond sonicare!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two Philips diamond clean (expensive) sonic care toothbrushes in the last two years. Not cool. That noisy head because the arms aren’t strong enough and they break. Get it right Philips, come on. So they have forced my hand to go to oral b. And wow. Didn’t think I could get a cleaner feeling around my teeth. Really sturdy and quiet. Love the red light gum alert, you can’t miss it, if your pushing to hard. The cross head brushes really do a good job. I’ll be buying more. Very happy indeed. So if you’ve always been a sonic, this is a good move away.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Just the job
customer_reviews.text: I had a battery toothbrush which wasn't that efficient, and this plug in one is very good. I already had a charger on the wall so I didn't need the one provided. It seems to last quite a while between charges, and the brilliant green light that lights up when it needs charging, and also while it is charging are very bright. I didn't want an all singing all dancing toothbrush, and this one is absolutely just the job for me. My teeth are cleaner, and I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope J

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a Phillips toothbrush which was excellent and lasted for years. This Oral-B has stopped charging after 7 months so it can’t be used. I also bought a children’s Oral-B toothbrush recently and that stopped charging after 2 weeks. Clearly a serious issue with these Oral-B toothbrushes and other reviews have confirmed charging issues. Very disappointed and struggling to work out how to get this sorted. Not looking forward to Oral-B offering me a replacement, I’d rather go back to Phillips!
customer_reviews.author: Fastzook

customer_reviews.title: Good value electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My dentist recommended I get an electric toothbrush as I was brushing too hard so I ordered one of these (my wife also got the pink one). It's been excellent so far and the timer function is really useful so you know you're brushing for long-enough. It also lights up if you're pressing too hard so I know I'm doing a better job than before. Battery is also very good. I've taken it away for a 10 day holiday, brushed 2-3 times per day and it's lasted the whole time. Replacement heads can be a bit pricey if you order the official ones but they do last a decent length of time. The travel case is also very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Misleading info re UK plug - it is not, you will need adaptors all the time to charge it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I got sick and tired of dragging around my other Oral B with adaptor just to live in the country I live in, i.e. UK. I specifically searched the description to see that it is a UK plug, it said two prong UK plug, so I assumed the two large UK suitable power point plug. It was not. Just normal EU plug. So annoying, and cannot be bothered now returning it. I really dislike when Amazon allows misleading and fraudulent statements like these that induce us consumers to buy, yet the reality does not correspond to description!
customer_reviews.author: GlobeTrotterGirl

customer_reviews.title: Lovely product and very clean teeth
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I just brought this toothbrush home. I used it just now and found the cleaning quality brilliant There was the notification to clean the next quadrant of your mouth. My mouth feels very clean and fresh. My teeth are very clean. The tongue test shows smooth surface of the teeth. Very impressed. Miles better than my older oral b electric toothbrush. Don't know about blue tooth connectivity yet because I haven't looked. Just connected with my plug with two holes. No problems I can see. Nice to hold and use. It is lighter than my older brush.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Range
customer_reviews.text: Do you really need a toothbrush that communicates your brushing habits to you via an app? No, you don't! Don't waste £200 on a bunch of features you'll never use, get this model instead. It brushes your teeth very very nicely. Feels great during and after. Heads are easy to change so the wife and I have a head each and share the base unit - charge lasts a week or so. Also got a tiny little head holder that sticks to the inside wall of the bathroom cabinet and keeps the heads clean and in place. All highly recommended, and WAY better than the cheaper AA powered Oral B's we replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. F. McPolin

customer_reviews.title: Good First Electric Toothbrush but Nothing More
customer_reviews.text: My first electric toothbrush. Cheap and does the job. It's nice to experience the electric toothbrush, especially Oral-B's rotating-oscillating technique (opposed to Phillips' sonic). The battery life is really a let down, quite disappointed that the battery only lasts about 3 days after 24h of charging, a couple of weeks deep into its usage. Predicting that I'll end up needing to charge it daily a few months down the line which is unacceptable which means I'm going to need to replace it. Some others have experienced my problem, but there are also others with the stated 2 week battery life. Do what you wish with this information, just giving you a heads up.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I had a more expensive toothbrush that did the job but I was not overly happy. This toothbrush, however, packs a punch where you actually feel that your teech are being cleaned. The red warning light is a welcome addition. The 2-pin shaver plug is a pain; I mean howmany people have access to a shaver socket. You need a conversion plug to use this with a conventional 3-pin socket and even then the plug gets loose. Other problem is that the grip is not that good; when the brush gets wet it starts slipping out of your hand. Overall its a good toothbrush and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Akkers

customer_reviews.title: An oldie but a goodie
customer_reviews.text: So for better or worse this is exactly the same as the Trizone 1000 I bought for £24 six years ago... the only differences I can find are this is 4 grams lighter (maybe no limescale yet?), there are two speeds, and apparently there's a timer too. It perhaps feels slightly more noisy than the old model. I did love my old toothbrush, but have things really not changed at all in so long? The black design does at least look really cool. Hope it lasts as long as my old toothbrush. I have already fitted it with a Trizone head. I do really appreciate the super visible pressure sensor LED.
customer_reviews.author: J. Axup

customer_reviews.title: Good toothbrush.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this toothbrush a few weeks and it is still on its first charge. So the battery life is excellent. The normal setting is too fast so I always only use the sensitive setting. The timer every 30 seconds is a little annoying but some people may like this. If one has still got one's wisdom teeth and a mouth which is not terribly big you may need to navigate a little in the back of your mouth. I keep hitting the back of the brush against other molars. My last braun lasted about 13 years so hopefully this will do the same.
customer_reviews.author: harpoline

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye conventional brushing!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first electric toothbrush I have owned and I am amazed at the results. When I first used it, I couldn't believe just how clean my teeth felt. The design of the toothbrush allows you to get into areas that would otherwise be difficult to reach and as it's a circular rotating brush, cleans the entire area of the tooth. It's also very smart and lights up when you apply too much pressure. I bought this December 2017 for £30 which at the time was much cheaper than in local retailers and it continues to work great. If you are thinking about making the change, don't hesitate like I did. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron P

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a basic older version of this toothbrush, once that packed in I went back to normal toothbrush’s. After a few years and many people telling me to upgrade again I finally did. Went with this one because it came with the travel case and seemed fairly priced. Have loved using this toothbrush and would recommend. My only complaint and the reason it hasn’t had 5stars is that when I was first using it obviously brushed harder or different to my older toothbrush’s and cut my gum and was painful to brush over for a couple of days. Now that I’m used to it it’s ace!
customer_reviews.author: Euan Harris

customer_reviews.title: Electric Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Braun toothbrush with this model and am very impressed by the extra length of the battery's life, I use it at least twice a day and find it lasting for 14 days normally. The timing per 'brush' is nice and loud and being hard of hearing I find this helpful. My only dislike is the on off button - the same design as my old model - easy to turn on but very difficult to turn off. Maybe its becasue I am in the 70+ age range and my fingers are not as strong but it does take awhile to turn the brush off.
customer_reviews.author: coffee

customer_reviews.title: Another replacement
customer_reviews.text: This will be my 10th or 11th Braun toothbrush ... I've used the same brand for more than 10 years and they're great. It's a shame that the battery dies after 2-3 years, usually just outside the warranty period ... but on the whole they work well and if you can keep them on a charger then you're fine. Otherwise I see 2-3 weeks initially, but by 3 years time I'm lucky if it holds charge for more than 2 days ... still at £25 they still work out as great value for money. Not sure about gimmicks like bluetooth connectivity, but as a toothbrush it works well
customer_reviews.author: redmail

customer_reviews.title: Much better than manual
customer_reviews.text: Never used a electric toothbrush prior to purchasing this one. Highly recommended, my teeth feel much cleaner and I would never go back to using a manual (until battery runs out!) Battery lasts for approximately a week when using if you stick to the toothbrush timer. Handy storage/carry case. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: MP74

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold charge
customer_reviews.text: Had the item less than a month and it failed to hold charge. It would be on charge for 24 hours and battery flat after another 10-12 hours. Despite “Innox Trading” accepting a return, they failed to honour this as they received it outside the 30 days. Best avoid this product as it’s rubbish and avoid Innox as their customer service leaves a bit to be desired too.
customer_reviews.author: Sherpatensing

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just over a month ago and having used a sonic toothbrush for many years I find this one bulky and mechanical. It makes my head rattle in comparison with my old sonic one which was much smoother. I haven't timed it, but the battery doesn't seem to last as long as advertised and the black parts of the brush get stained with the toothpaste. That said, if you like this style of toothbrush it does seem to give a good clean which is what's important. Personally I'm going back to sonic next time.
customer_reviews.author: nemesis

customer_reviews.title: No better than the cheapest Oral B electric brushes
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Oral B electric brushes for 20+ years. Have tried various ones and while the Pro 2 2500 may be good its not a night and day difference compared to the most basic Oral B brushes, or the most expensive models. My conclusion, just buy whatever Oral B electric toothbrush is the least expensive at the time your in the market and you'll be happy. They're all good and the batteries all lose capacity given time and only one Oral B has every just died completely on me so you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant toothbrush and indicator light really helps
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrush build is really solid and good quality, and the battery life is great; I barely ever need to charge it. The travel case it comes with is actually pretty useful, and you can pack away your toothbrush pretty compactly. The pressure indicator light is a really big help in telling me when I am applying too much pressure. Additionally, the built-in quadrant timer is probably the most useful part of this toothbrush and helps me get an even clean. It really is a great electric toothbrush!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Polished clean
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace an Oral-B electric brush that had given good service over a few years use, but the battery was needing recharging more and moore frequently. Did some research and this 2500N model seemed the best value for money. Wow! it's so much better than my old one, it really cleans all the knocks and crannies of your teeth. There are lights to show when each quarter of your teeth have had a good brush and a useful over-pressuring alert. My teeth feel polished and shiny after use. The battery is just AMAZING, it gives at least 2 to 3-weeks use with twice a day brushing. Thoroughly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE CUNDY

customer_reviews.title: The flashing light for when you brush too hard is the best about this
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older model and really like the pressure light function. I simply don’t see the reason for an all sing and dancing toothbrush! The Lights flash if you brush too hard which is a problem my dentist always mention. Amazing battery life. Have been using for two weeks twice a day and haven’t needed to charge it. The timer function is handy as you know when to move to the next section. Don’t think there is a Bluetooth functionality not that I wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: mmmmmmmmmm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my first electric toothbrush and I've found it excellent so far, very glad I made the change. I was originally looking at some of the more expensive ones with extra functions and gadgets but this has everything I need. The functions it has are practical and useful - the pressure sensor to let you know if you are brushing too hard and the timer which vibrates each 30 secs and longer after 2 mins. This version also comes with a travel case, I've not used it yet but it seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold charge, dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: This product was great when it worked, but stopped working properly after around 12 months or less. It would lose charge after one or two used, after bieng fully charged. Now it might charge fully, then will die after around a minute. I just didn't expect this product from a reputable company to be useless after such a short time. Had I known that I'd have gone for a cheaper brand. I imagine this might be a fault with my item, perhaps, but it had passed the returns date by the point it started to do that so couldn't return. Dissapointing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This wakes you up in the morning 😊
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a sonic, mostly because of the price/brand name. I find it very loud & it has a really strong vibration when it’s switched on & I was surprised by this, I really don’t like these aspects at all. But, I bought it to clean my teeth & knew it was a ‘no frills’ buy & it does the job well, so this is just a personal preference. I will probably go for a quieter/smoother operating one again & keep this one for travelling All in all, does the job it’s meant to.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: My first electric toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: My dentist recommended I bought an electric toothbrush to improve my teeth-cleaning routine, and suggested that I buy 'anything over a version 2500'. This model was a particularly good price, and I didn't need all of the fancy things that the newer models offered. I am sure that many people would benefit from the newer models' functionality, but personally we were perfectly happy with this toothbrush. Me and my boyfriend have now had these for 6 months, and we can say that the battery life is brilliant, cleans teeth well and the travel container it comes with is super handy. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: not happy with the one sent out./  I'm happy now!
customer_reviews.text: The box was not sealed and the handle part was not even in a bag! I turned it on and the thing sounds like its going to explode! I think I shall be returning this! I'm really disappointed. I've been speaking to Oral B about the issues above and also about a gap that appears between the holder and brush, I even sent them a video and assured that this is all normal so I've changed my 1 star to a 4 star as the seller did their job and the brush may be loud but does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Lee - IOW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tooth brush for the good price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tooth brush. Does the job in "daily clean" mode very well, much better than manual tooth brush. Other modes appeared not very useful. So more expensive models, which just add extra modes, are questionable investments. Pressure sensor was in use, especially in the beginning. Battery lasts approx. 15-20 cleanings. Charger is quite slow (may take 24 hrs), but it is wireless, so understandable. Travel case is definitely worth extra 5 pounds above Oral-B Pro 2000.
customer_reviews.author: Denis B

customer_reviews.title: Made In Germany not China (like Sonicare)
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Sonicare toothbrushes every since I can remember, but now deciding to take a stance against things made in China, my replacement toothbrush had to be an Oral B one (made in Germany). I didn't want lots of unnecessary extras on it so opted for this one. It's a lot different to a Sonicare and now I'm used to it it's easily as good. It feels like it's cleaning my teeth more and my gums certainly get more a clean. Apparently it'll warn when brushing too hard but I can't get it to do that even when I try.
customer_reviews.author: Rudi

customer_reviews.title: Quite noisy but small size of vibrating head allows access to all the books and crannies...
customer_reviews.text: ... leaving my teeth feeling really clean. Another feature is that it gives timing beeps every thirty seconds, including a triple beep at 2 minutes, but doesn’t automatically stop, so that it is easy to do “that little bit extra” - or immediately rinse the moving head under the tap, which is what the manufacturer recommends. I haven’t had it long enough to comment on battery life.
customer_reviews.author: DragonLady

customer_reviews.title: Electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item 15minths ago, it’s never charged up propley since I got it, I know my guarantee had run out, I should of reported this before now, it stops flashing telling me it’s flully charged then I switch it on then it flashes red telling me it’s not charged, I’m very weary of buying this item again, to whom it may concern.
customer_reviews.author: Sharonbegley

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well
customer_reviews.text: The head of this toothbrush is quite chunky and it took a while to get used to it, especially around my back teeth, but it cleans well. It came with a case but I couldn't get the toothbrush to fit into it so I had to cut some of the plastic case away to make it fit. Maybe I was doing it wrong, but for those of you who have difficulty like I did, rest assured that if you do cut the case the toothbrush will fit fine and the case will close. No problems with the battery so far. Not sure what the bluetooth function is though.
customer_reviews.author: trish

customer_reviews.title: Annoying light
customer_reviews.text: They introduced a pressure light that is annoying as possible. It is flashing light straight into my face / eyes while I am brushing. And there doesn't see to be any way to get rid of that light. I don't expect a toothbrush to aggressively annoy me. This is just ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my older, better model that the battery life had deteriorated to the point where it would just die halfway through. The cleaning performance is exactly the same and although it doesn't have the same number of modes, I never used to use them anyway, plus this model came with a hard travel case which the old model didnt.
customer_reviews.author: ChrissyNix

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one to replace an old toothbrush which wouldn't hold its charge anymore and I am really impressed with this one. Great battery life, brushes like no toothbrush I've ever used before. Teeth feel super clean. I also like that it has 2 speeds so if my teeth are particularly sensitive one day I can use the slower setting and still get a great clean. Would recommend. Excellent toothbrush and very reasonably priced too.
customer_reviews.author: Floortje

customer_reviews.title: Missing toothbrush head
customer_reviews.text: I just received my oral b Pro 2 2500 and there's no toothbrush head in the box! I double checked the description and it says that the box contains the head. Amazon redirects me to Oral B website but I cannot find my product and the type number is not fully visible on it. How will I get the head? Also the box wasn't originally sealed.
customer_reviews.author: Aron Szepvolgyi

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush 100% recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great toothbrush. Cleans really well, my teeth feel smooth and plaque free after every brush. My old electronic toothbrush broke and I was using a manual for a while. After reverting back to electric, I can honestly say I see and feel a huge difference in my teeth. Investing in a decent electric toothbrush is a must nowadays! You don’t need the fancy settings that come with the more expensive models.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality toothbrush.
customer_reviews.text: If, like me, you've never spent more than £20 on a toothbrush before, you'll notice an immediate improvement in quality from what you've used before. It's built to last, doesn't have unnecessary bluetooth features and the warning light that you're pressing too hard is quite useful. It's a solid purchase, it's worth the cash if the price is reduced. I picked it up for around £33, camelcamelcamel shows that the price drops to £30. The last time this product sold at full price (£70) was in January 2015, and ever since then it's been reduced - I think that's common for toothbrushes on Amazon, don't be scammed by paying the full price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well
customer_reviews.text: I have found this Braun toothbrush to be superior to my previous Braun which I had for a few years. The battery life is much better. The red flashing light and the way that the brush slows down when getting ready for a recharge is helpful. It may just be me but I think that the brush is quite a bit noisier when in use than my previous one. However I am really pleased with it and thought it was good value for money at the offer price.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerman

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Loving this new toothbrush. Yes it’s expensive but it was on sale when I bought it. Charge is excellent lasts a week and it make your teeth feel like you’ve just been to the hygienist after each brush. Timer option is good to so you split time equally between inner, outer and top and bottom teeth. Best bit by far is the carry case, no need to compromise with normal toothbrush when travelling
customer_reviews.author: Angela Appleford

customer_reviews.title: Effective at cleaning teeth
customer_reviews.text: Previous 2500 stopped charging after 10 months,Braun sent me a replacement of a lower spec model with 1 week battery life, insisted it was the same despite my sending photos of model number and box. I did not want to buy Oral B again but I did not like features of other makes and I had 12 replacement brush heads for Oral B. I am pleased with it so far and I hope it lasts better than previous one, they are very good when they work..
customer_reviews.author: Chara

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, but cleans OK, dead after just over four months
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, but quite good at cleaning teeth. I bought two in April and one died in August, dead isn't quite the description, zombie would be a better description as it won't come on when the button is pressed, but will come on randomly day and night. Took me a while to figure out what was waking me up! Now for the fun of getting a replacement or a refund...
customer_reviews.author: Dr D.M. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Good toothbrush, affordable and easy to use and charge
customer_reviews.text: Good toothbrush with good battery life, nice travel case, looks good, easy to use. Affordable pricing with changeable brush heads for different dental areas available for purchase. One thing I think would be better is if the brush made a noise to mark the 30 second markers instead of alternating the movement of the brush. If you brush for the full 2 minutes twice a day the batter will last a week till the red light appears prompting a recharge but if you forget to charge it then it will probably last another 2 or 3 brushes before complete battery drain.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: VERY LONG BATTERY LIFE.
customer_reviews.text: Received this on the 11th Aug, charged it for 10-12hrs (until the green light stopped flashing). Been brushing twice a day for the recommended time for 12days and still no sign of the battery being low. The speed is much quicker then my old one (cant remember the model), and it feels better. It does take a few days to get used to, so if you have sore gums you might want to use the 2nd slower speed. So far so good, glad i bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Maj H

customer_reviews.title: A very good toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my son. His old one was filled with toothpaste residue, this is one of oral b flaw in general I have noticed, but I he had his previous one for quite some time. This one looks really nice, my son loves that it is black, it has a case for our travels and it seems that the battery lasts for ever! Very happy with my purchase! I have recommended it for my son’s friends and my nieces without second thought!
customer_reviews.author: pepperc

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic, ordered first one
customer_reviews.text: Pathetic, ordered first one, after first FULL charge, not working, holds the charge for about a hour then DEAD. SO.... ordered a replacement, yes you guessed exactly the same, read the instruction back to back, then turned off and on again, and rechecked - battery just doesn't hold a charge. As I am a electronics engineer, I thought about taking it apart. But I would rather just put it out of it's misery with a Lump Hammer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: Best electric toothbrush i've ever had. Has very helpful timer functions, so you know how long to brush for. I particularly like the red light indicator that highlights to warn of brushing too hard. As someone who's been told off for this by dentists it is the most useful feature. Also has warning light for low battery, and unlike previous models, it gradually slows when battery goes low, rather than suddenly cut out. Good battery life, only needs a charge once a week. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: the mutts nuts

customer_reviews.title: Really good item
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about Bluetooth or timer function on this but it does what it's supposed to, previously had a model it's still working but battery dies quicker on that although I've had it almost 10 years. The battery on this is far superior have only charged it once since bought it, seen photos of some ppl showing heads not fitting, that's because u need to press the head in, tried the original and after market heads, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kam K

customer_reviews.title: Super clean teeth
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I got these at Christmas to treat ourselves. Before that we just had manual toothbrushes. These were middle of the road price-wise and highly rated. I see why! Both of us agree our teeth have never felt so clean. Don’t use any of the fancy features but the buzz that tells you when to switch brushing position is handy. Makes me pay attention to what I’m doing. The charge is pretty good and we get a couple of weeks out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Burrell

customer_reviews.title: really clean your teeth
customer_reviews.text: and the timer makes sure you don't cheat. This model has no added communication devices, doesn't talk to your mobile phone, doesn't download to your computer or tell you the news, doesn't talk to your friends on social media. Just brushes your teeth really well. I use it with a flosser head. My third in 10 years - first lasted 5 years, last one only one year (battery stopped keeping charge) hence 4 stars in stead of 5 stars. Assuming last one's battery was a quality control glitsch, really good value at £35. Now downgraded to 3* as the latest one (15 months old) suddenly switched on in the middle of the night and then stopped working
customer_reviews.author: Dougal Melrose

customer_reviews.title: Superior to my old one
customer_reviews.text: A replacement for a much older version. Unlike the many reviews that stated problems with the battery, mine is working perfectly and hope it follows my old one which is ? years old and battery still going strong. I like this model as it has a stronger setting (with a softer setting if required which is similar to my old one) Wish they would stop changing the brush fitting, I now have brushes which will never get used.
customer_reviews.author: DK Butler

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life Lies
customer_reviews.text: I specifically paid more for this model because I seemed to be constantly charging my cheaper Oral B Pro 650 and it was annoying. As Oral B claim "Two plus weeks of brushing with one charge" in their marketing I thought I'd keep track of it. From when it arrived, fully charged it, and then used 2 mins twice a day, the red battery light started flashing on the morning of day 10. And this is brand new, so I don't know how long it will last after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy and brushead rattling
customer_reviews.text: Bought this toothbrush initially to replace my Oral B Triumph which was originally bought in 2009. Unfortunately though as soon as I started to use it, I noticed that it was really noisy and the brush head was making a loud rattling noise. We also have an Oral B Pro 2 2000N and my Oral B Triumph and both brushes were not as loud as this new Oral B Pro 2 2500N. I suspect that the issue could be with the actual motor, or the spindle that holds the brush. Sent the toothbrush back to Amazon for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Effective? 100%. Value for money? Just about.
customer_reviews.text: Could be more value for money. Oral-B try to sell toothbrushes that are way too expensive for what they are, but they work, at least. This could do with an extra little item or two to make it worth it. Add a timer and a holder and immediately they ask you for £90! Other than the value, it really does work. I’ve used these for some time and will continue doing so. They also come in different colours, should you not want to mix up or want a little more customisation. Perhaps interchangeable plastics for customisation would be something for Oral-B to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but improvements needed
customer_reviews.text: Nice brush, but much more ‘rickety’ than expected. I was expecting a smoother action, more like a sonic brush. This one is very loud and makes a lot of freaks and such. Hard-brush indicator and timing function both very useful. Charge stays well, but you feel the loss in power as the battery goes down. Shame the travel case doesn’t allow you to keep the head attached.
customer_reviews.author: EEC

customer_reviews.title: Usefull tip if you have a charging problem
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well although it feels a bit agricultural compared to the Sonicare I have used in the past. The black body gets an ugly white coating very quickly. First use and the charge lasted about 21 brushes and after that it was down to 5 brushes! Contacted customer services who were very helpfull and when discussing the problem I was asked if I charge the brush near any metal. I was changing it on top of a LED mirror and they asked me to try charging it elsewhere. Charging it away from the mirror and I am back up to about 21 brushes for a 24hr charge.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the best toothbrushes in its' price range, it does what it says on the tin with good battery life and I also like the pressure sensor, so if you press to hard you know about it. I think the carrying case is poor quality but it is a good toothbrush overall and it is something I have and will continue to recommend based on value for money and it being a good brush overall.
customer_reviews.author: ProductWarrior

customer_reviews.title: A sound purchase. Revomnended
customer_reviews.text: The many good reviews for this toothbrush are there for a good reasons. I recommend thuhisvtoothbrush for various reasons.I tried the batter version with AA batteries but found it wasn't powerful enough and it was difficult to replace the battery over. This brush has got the right features (light when charging, 30sec timer, case, good battery life, over-pressure warning light. idid a fair bit of research prior to buying this and was not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead after 3 months of normal use
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t charge any more. It stopped suddenly while I was using it. I see in england it’s only one city that services and it’s not here in manchester.....it’s Olympic Shaver Centre Ltd Calverton Business park NG14 6QL Nottingham Just in case you have the same issue UPDATE: Received second brush on warranty and it died after a few months in the same way.... I think this model has clear issues.
customer_reviews.author: Lucian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Ive had the older oral-b toothbrush and its battery life became really short. So i bought this one, slightly worried that the battery life may not be good as per reviews. But I'm happy to report battery life is great, holds charge well. The general features work great and the black edition looks great. Another good thing is that with the old model dirt used to build up around the toothbrush, it looks like they've fixed this. Will come back and update this review if there are any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Aurangzeb

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We only bought this on the 17th March this year and it now hardly works. It will only hold it’s charge for about 36 hours. Not impressed. Maybe it is just a one off faulty item, but I am going to try and return it and get either a free replacement or my money back!!!!! Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Evie613

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, just what the doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: This model has two modes, daily clean and sensitive, it automatically starts on daily clean and can change to sensitive through a press of the power button. I have only had this product a week and I can already feel and see the difference. My gums were sore at first as I used a manual brush before but now they feel much more firm and healthy. This toothbrush also has a pressure sensor light at the back to alert you when you are pushing down too much. Overall, this toothbrush is great with a very reasonable price and produces a very good result on your teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Bad service
customer_reviews.text: I have had three Oral B in the space of a few months and both have stopped working in a very short time, the last one wouldn't even charge all from Amazon. I contacted Amazon and they said they would get back to me but I have heard nothing. Amazon will have a record of my purchase. Am very disappointed in Amazon service and in the standard of workmanship from Braun.
customer_reviews.author: Barry P.

customer_reviews.title: Loses all of its charge within a couple of hours
customer_reviews.text: Loses all of its charge within a couple of hours. If you don't put it back on the charger you'll find it completely dead when you come round to brushing your teeth again. I got a replacement and exactly the same thing happened so clearly this is just a problem with this model. I have made sure to charge it for a couple of days straight so that the battery is as charged as it can be, still it just went dead. Very unhappy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: James Tasker

customer_reviews.title: Lost power (while fully recharged) after less than three months of use
customer_reviews.text: I appreciated the great cleaning ability of this toothbrush until, after less than 3 months of use, it suddenly lost power. I had recently recharged it. Normally the charge lasts for about a week, and when the battery is low, a red warning light flashes. So, the fully charged internal battery has developed a fault. Checking Braun's website, the battery cannot be replaced. Checking my Amazon account, it is too late for me to return this item. I bought it full price as an investment for my dental health. I feel ripped off
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing dental  hygiene
customer_reviews.text: My first electronic toothbrush, perhaps if I had used one earlier my moth hygiene my have improved- amazing piece of kit fells like I had just been to the practise hygienist. I bought it because I had a call saying it would be 2021 until I could see the dentist. As I say it worked a treat and cleaned out stubborn plaque Actually cost around the same as a trip to the dentist
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB TOOTH BRUSH
customer_reviews.text: What can one say about a tooth brush, it cleans my teeth well, this version lights up if you press too hard, so as to protect your gums, well mine lights up all the time as I brush hard for max cleaning. DOWNSIDE THE BRUSH HEADS ARE COSTLY AND DON'T LAST LONG. Apparently the most recommended toothbrush by dentists. Dentists, where else can you go to pay huge amounts of money for pain !!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W. Brierley

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: this toothbrush is the best choice imo, because it doeant have all the unnecessary feathers like bluetooth(which do practically nothing) it not too expencive and includes a travel case too this brush has long battery life and vibrates to tell you the almond of time that has passed which is all you really need.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great rechargeable tooth brush
customer_reviews.text: My hygienist recommended that I change to a rechargeable tooth brush rather than the battery one I was using. Like lots of things as you go up the model range price goes up with it. She recommended this version (as she too uses this model). Must say I am converted, no more faffing around with replacing AA batteries and I must say the battery like is good. I don't leave it in the charger and charge it once a week which lasts me all week (brushing properly at least twice a day). Recommended and the old battery model has been put to good use as my travel option (using the case you get with this one!). Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Amazing toothbrush when it works.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing toothbrush when it works. There are some problems with the battery control logic, it thinks that the battery is dead every time I leave the toothbrush without charger. Placing the toothback on the charger shows full battery, and the toothbrush starts working again and can go for 30 minutes. I'll try to fully discharge/recharge to see if this helps, if not will ask for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I Got This For My Son For Christmas
customer_reviews.text: So I can’t really comment yet on how it performs, I will say I bought an Oral B electric toothbrush over 20 years ago and it’s still going strong (and the replacement heads still fit) if this one is as good as my vintage one I’ll be very happy. Post Christmas Update: my son is very pleased with this electric toothbrush, it works very well, it’s powerful and easy to set up and holds its battery charge well. Oral-B still make great electric toothbrushes :)
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Product is good and it does what is supposed to do well, the feeling after using it is nice and the signal that let you know when change area of the mouth is a useful (funny) feature. The travel case that came with it is solid and useful to store the product even at home. The only negative point that I found so far is the charger that works only with 220~240V, disappointing for a product that is ment to go with you wherever you go.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: So far, So good. After initially charging the battery for 12 hours. The Toothbrush gave approx. 14 days of useage similar to the older NiMh battery versions. The Cross-Action Brush Head gives a very hard brushing action suitable for experienced electric toothbrush users. The 2nd recharge took approx. 11-12 hours until the green Led stopped flashing and went out. As for long-term useage? only time will tell.?
customer_reviews.author: SilverBack

customer_reviews.title: Give your teeth a thorough clean
customer_reviews.text: Switched from manual to this electronic brush last year. Got this as a spare to take abroad when I travel for work. Battery life is promising compared to old model I already have. Timer function is a great reminder to clean all your teeth and the pressure light reflects when you are applying excessive pressure. Really like the black colour and travel case it comes with. No faults so far!
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Oral-B Pro 2 2500 CrossAction Electric Toothbrush Rechargeable Powered by Braun
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Braun, Oral-B electric tooth brushes before and have found them excellent, especially when purchased below the RRP. It has good battery life, but this is difficult to measure, but I have no complaints. It does not have Bluetooth connectivity and I did not expect it to have this facility. Timer function works as advertised. I am, as usual, pleased with this item
customer_reviews.author: Mike W8

customer_reviews.title: IMHO better than a Sonic Care
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Sonic Care nigh on since they were released. I have the Diamond Clean which I bought from Amazon 3 years ago and it still works great but even with all of the functions for 'Polishing' teeth and Deep cleaning I felt it was not very good. My Partner has a Oral B an old one but still functional, she suggested I tried her's. I was suprised how well it went between my teeth and bits of plaque were visable when I rinsed my mouth. So I bought this one and must say 3 weeks on I am impressed. Teeth feel cleaner and mouth fresher. Sorry Philips!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hewson

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric brush
customer_reviews.text: For the last few years I’ve had a So I’ve Phillips small headed electric toothbrush but the cost of replacing was out of my reach so have gone with this. It will be Interesting to hear comments from my dentist on whether I’m achieving a good standard of cleaning. I wish there was the option of smaller or mini head too. Two speed settings just fine for me. Nice handle grip. Good price. A brand I would use again.
customer_reviews.author: Love2shop2015

product_meta.title: Oral-B Pro 2500 Electric Rechargeable Toothbrush Powered By Braun - Black

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
